positions.title: Software Development Engineer
positions.description:
I worked at CertiVox developing web-based security products for military-grade communications in the financial, law, and public sectors. During my time there I designed and developed the world’s first end-to-end secure email client in JavaScript/HTML5 (http:// www.privatesky.me), using elliptical curve cryptography for data encryption and message signing and verification.

I enabled the encryption of files over 500MB in-browser via pushing the capabilities of HTML5 web workers to the limit, so encryption is ‘chunked’, queued, and processed via 3 asynchronous workers so even web browsers on slow computers didn’t experience browser lockup.

The encryption libraries were developed by Professor Mike Scott, which I became educated and familiarised with. I helped port them to JavaScript by working with libraries developed by Stanford University, oversaw compatibility testing with Managed C++ and C# libraries, and finally made sure their integration with the UX in an email client was as seemless as possible. The ported libraries surpassed benchmarks achieved by Stanford libraries, and the additional functionality achieved with HTML5 web workers allowed me to produce an enterprise-level solution to encrypting email attachments.

I also developed compatibility testing tools, for example, to make sure a message encrypted on iOS could be decrypted in a web browser in JavaScript. Other notable projects included designing and developing company dashboards to display product usage and sales metrics, in HTML5, CSS3 and .NET (C#) backend, connecting to an API interfacing the MongoDB datastore.

Andy is one the best front-end developer I worked with. His knowledge of Jquery, Javascript and HTML5 are second to none. Andy is personable and a great team player. I would not hesitate to recommend him to anyone and certainly would like to work with him again.

Andy is a proven expert with a vast experience, deep understanding about the technologies he uses, a reliable and very responsible team player and always fresh-minded and smiling. I do recommend Andy to any company/individual/customer that needs a strong professional with enormous pool of knowledge and experience.

It's very rare to come across developers as keen and as professional as Andy. Without a doubt the best UX designer I have known, leaving no stone un-turned. Always a pleasure to work with and dedicated to hitting deadlines.

received.text:
Clara's talent doesn't go unnoticed on projects. She consistently produces magic no matter what pressures are applied, as we found on a couple of challenging projects for Google in the past year.

The work she's done has been seen by millions of people around the globe, and it's often the small details which make her work the reason why people smile.

You can add Clara to any team and she'll not only do an amazing job but she'll also boost the mood of everyone around her! This was one of the easiest recommendations I've had to write.

Pedro is a very rare type of frontend developer who possesses an acute eye for detail. The solutions he produces are completely unique. A true master of all things CSS, he is never happy until he has nailed the design, user experience, and performance of a web page. Pedro is not afraid to question any aspect of wireframes or design, identifying potential problems early on which end up saving hours of time on a project.He goes out of his way to ensure RWD is implemented properly, working closely with design and UX to make sure he gets the best possible result.

In the last year Pedro has led the frontend development of important projects, and shown he is more than capable of managing more than his own workload, designing object-orientated architecture for complex frontend builds and running code reviews with a team.

Pedro is the type of developer people love working with. He brings not just technical and visual skills, but he really is a top bloke and extremely fun to work with.
